column4: After upgrading to 8.10 my custom keyboard layout doesn't load anymore and the /etc/X11/xkb directory it's almost empty. I understand that this version uses HAL for input stuff, but does anyone knows how to customize my keyboard layout again?
same way you did it before... System > Preferences > Keyboard
I edited my files to create a new layout, a combination between Romanian and Dvorak
I dunno where such files will go... did you put them back into the directory you stated?
I've edited /etc/X11/xkb/symbols/ro and /etc/X11/xkb/rules/xorg.xml to create my custom layout, but in 8.10 xkb is missing rules and symbols directories
I'm fairly sure they weren't moved though  :/
i've asked and they said they said there are in the same place!
ok... then they are... why can't you just create the files yourself?
just cuz they weren't created for you doesn't mean its not the right config file  :/
they can't be, because that directory doesn't exists now
the base.xml file had other name, and all the layouts are missing, they can't be hardcoded in the X
ok... keep arguing with the xorg developers then...
then throw the whole file in there that you backed up
if anyone else asks, /etc/X11/xkb has moved to /usr/share/X11/xkb/
